results.title: Pakistan denounces US sanctions on its missile program as ... - CNN
results.content: Pakistan denounces US sanctions on its missile program as ‘discriminatory’ | CNN Africa Americas Asia Australia China Europe India Middle East United Kingdom Follow CNN CNN10 CNN 5 Things About CNN The US State Department said one such sanctioned entity, the Islamabad-based National Development Complex, worked to acquire items for developing Pakistan’s long range ballistic missile program that includes the SHAHEEN series of ballistic missiles. The latest US sanctions came months after similar measures were slapped on other foreign entities, including a Chinese research institute, after the US State Department accused them of working for the National Development Complex, which it says was involved in the development and production of Pakistan’s long-range ballistic missiles. CNN10 About CNN Follow CNN

answer:
The latest updates on US sanctions programs include several recent actions and designations:

On January 17, 2025, the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) issued Balkans-related, Counter Terrorism, and Cyber-related designations. They also issued a Counter Terrorism General License and announced a settlement agreement with Haas Automation, Inc. On January 16 and 15, 2025, OFAC made additional sanctions list updates. Russia-related designations were issued on January 15, along with Russia-related and Russia/Ukraine-related General Licenses. OFAC also implemented the Federal Civil Penalties Inflation Adjustment Act on this date. Further sanctions list updates occurred on January 13, 10, and 7, 2025. Recent country-specific sanctions updates include those related to the Balkans, cyber activities, Lebanon, Nicaragua, and Venezuela. The US has also imposed sanctions on Pakistan's missile program, specifically targeting the National Development Complex in Islamabad, which was accused of working on Pakistan's long-range ballistic missile program, including the SHAHEEN series of missiles.
